I'm a Houston Rockets fan. Channel one gives NBA games live coverage. Rockets' game against Phoenix Suns got widespread coverage in the media. Their game against Chicago Bulls was also given wide press coverage. They seem to be given a lot of newspaper 📰coverage because their games are exciting to watch. Next Sunday, the organization is gonna hold a chairmanship election. Channel five will be giving the election detailed coverage. If you want to check out the reports of Rockets' final games over the past ten years, their monthly magazines offer detailed coverage of them. If you wanna watch the highlights of their final games in the last decades, channel five provides in-depth coverage of these highlights. The book "Basketball Techniques" gives extensive three-point shooting technique coverage. Tokyo Mobile 📱now has nationwide coverage with its network which far outshines other service providers. Their coverage used to be poor used to be poor in Osaka which affected how people could access the internet but nowadays, it's considered one of the best. Their coverage is fantastic throughout the country. I'm a trumpeter. I'm currently looking at a couple insurance plans and choosing one which offers the most adequate life, medical and health coverage. I'm thinking of paying an additional premium to have insurance coverage for accidental damage to my trumpet 🎺as well as increasing the cover up to sixty eight billion nine hundred fifty five million five hundred forty four thousand eight hundred and eighty eight dollars.

Austin Rivers recorded a career-high 41-point performance on Sunday, the second-most points by a Rockets reserve (Mike Dunleavy had 48 in 1980).

The Rockets are the fourth team in league history to have four different players score 40+ points in a game during one season:

1969-70 Bullets (Mike Davis, Kevin Loughery, Jack Marin, and Earl Monroe)
1988-89 Suns (Tom Chambers, Armen Gilliam, Eddie Johnson, and Kevin Johnson)
2007-08 Nuggets (Carmelo Anthony, Allen Iverson, Linas Kleiza, and J.R. Smith)
2019-20 Rockets (James Harden, Russell Westbrook, Eric Gordon, and Austin Rivers)
